verses.verse: And I, brothers, wasn't able to speak to you as to spiritual people, but as to physical, as to infants in the Anointed King.
I gave you milk to drink and not food. You see, you weren't yet able, but neither are you still able now;
for you are still physical. You see, where there is passion, fighting, and factions among you, are you not physical and traipse around in line with a person?
You see, when someone says, "I certainly am of Paul," but a different person, "I am of Apollos," are you not physical beings?
So who is Paul? Who is Apollos? But the servants through whom you trusted and to each as the Master gave.
I planted. Apollos watered. But God was growing it.
In such a way, neither is the one planting anything, nor the one watering, but the one who is something is the One growing it, God.
The person planting and the person watering are one. Each will receive his own pay in line with his own labor.
You see, we are God's co-workers. You are God's farmland, God's building.

In line with the generosity of God, the generosity given to me, as an insightful head constructor, I have laid a foundation, but another person builds on it. Each person must watch how he builds on it.
You see, another foundation no one is able to lay contrary to the one lying there, that is Jesus, the Anointed King.
If someone builds on this foundation gold, silver, valuable stones, wood, grass, straw,
the work of each person will become shown. You see, the Judgment Day will make it obvious because it is uncovered in fire, and the work of each person (what kind it is) the fire will prove.
If the work of someone remains, what he built on Him, he will receive pay.
If the work of someone will be burned up, he will sustain loss. He himself will be rescued, but like this: as through fire.
Don't you realize that you are a temple of God and the Spirit of God has a house in you?
If anyone worsens the temple of God, God will worsen this person. You see, the temple of God is sacred, something that you are.
No one must completely fool himself. If anyone among you seems to be insightful in this span of time, he must become foolish so that he might become insightful.
You see, the insight of this world is foolishness beside God; for it has been written, (in Job 5:13) "The One grasping the insightful people in their slyness,"
and again, (in Psalm 94:11) "The Master knows the considerations of the insightful people, that they are futile."
In such a way, no one must brag about people. You see, everything is yours.
Whether Paul, or Apollos, or Cephas (Aramaic for Peter), or the world, or life, or death, or things that have stood here, or things that are going to be, all are yours.
You are the Anointed King's. The Anointed King is God's.
